intro: Oreophilus chelosepalus, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to high-altitude regions. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous or forested areas. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from rocky soil, and it plays a vital role in its ecosystem. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in many regions.
